alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Hill (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 26 at 11:58AM MST until December 27 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST MONDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to two inches. * WHERE...Blaine and Hill Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 5 PM MST Monday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
